images.title: Brendan and Ruth McCartney / Winnersh - Lavell's Lake
images.caption: Winnersh - Lavell's Lake. This lake is part of the Dinton Pastures complex, near Winnersh. It is a favourite haunt for local birders who enjoy the facilities of two hides.

description: Enjoy 7 lakes, 2 rivers, 3 bird hides and several meadows in this terrific 335 acre park in Hurst. There are excellent facilities with a Rangers Office, cafe, picnic area and the Dinton Activity Centre where kayaking, canoeing, sailing, powerboating and climbing activities are available. The Museum of Berkshire Aviation and the headquarters of the British Entomological and Natural History Society are also located in the park. It's a great place for birdwatching with a number of species to see on the water. There are three bird hides where you can enjoy the scene. A few miles to the south there's California Country Park where there are more good lakeside walking trails and wildlife watching opportunities. The National Trust's Finchampstead Ridges can also be visited in this area.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a cafe on site at the park with outdoor seating and nice views across the park.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is great for dog walking so you'll probably see other owners on your visit. There are seperate dog walking trails and the cafe mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: About a mile to the north you can pick up the Twyford Walk and explore the Loddon Nature Reserve and Charvil Country Park. There's a number of pretty pools here with lots of birdlife to look out for on the water. There's also riverside trails along the River Loddon and a decent pub right next to the reserve. For more walking ideas in the area see the Berkshire Walks page.

display_address: The Museum Of Berkshire Aviation, Mohawk Way, Woodley, Wokingham, England, RG5 4UE, United Kingdom
